issue.title: test(ssr): add basic directives test

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

issue.body:

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update

- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [ ] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [ ] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

**Other information:**

#9167

body:
Happens with nuxt & vuetify.
```
 ERROR  [Vue warn]: Failed to resolve directive: touch                                                       23:47:21

(found in <Anonymous>)
```
The cause is https://github.com/vuejs/vue/pull/9129 -> if this code reverted it resolve fine

issue.title: chore(deps): update all non-major dependencies
issue.body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| eslint | devDependencies | minor | `^5.9.0` -> `^5.10.0` | [homepage](https://eslint.org), [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/eslint/eslint) |
| lerna | devDependencies | minor | `^3.5.1` -> `^3.6.0` | [homepage](https://lernajs.io/), [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna) |
| vue | dependencies | patch | `^2.5.17` -> `^2.5.18` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/vuejs/vue) |
| vue-server-renderer | dependencies | patch | `^2.5.17` -> `^2.5.18` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/vuejs/vue) |
| vue-template-compiler | dependencies | patch | `^2.5.17` -> `^2.5.18` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/vuejs/vue) |

##### Bug Fixes

-   **pkg:** Exclude **mocks** from package tarball ([4017f37](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/4017f37))

##### Features

-   **add:** Add --no-bootstrap option ([89bb928](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/89bb928))
-   **bootstrap:** Support `--force-local` option ([#​1807](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/issues/1807)) ([25572af](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/25572af)), closes [#​1763](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/issues/1763)
-   Migrate existing usage to libnpm ([0d3a786](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/0d3a786)), closes [#​1767](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/issues/1767)
-   **create:** Migrate `npm info` subprocess to libnpm.manifest ([65a1d1b](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/65a1d1b))
-   **listable:** Add --toposort option ([b387881](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/b387881)), closes [#​1652](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/issues/1652)
-   **npm-dist-tag:** Use fetch API instead of CLI to make changes ([54008c6](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/54008c6))
-   **publish:** Add a "from-package" positional argument ([#​1708](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/issues/1708)) ([16611be](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/16611be)), closes [#​1648](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/issues/1648)
-   **publish:** Attempt profile retrieval before whoami endpoint during user validation ([38097d8](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/commit/38097d8))

#### [3.5.1](https://renovatebot.com/gh/lerna/lerna/compare/v3.5.0...v3.5.1) (2018-11-29)

body:
Is this still an issue?
`[Vue warn]: Failed to resolve directive: click-away`

"vue": "3.2.4" 
"vue3-click-away": "^1.2.4"

issue.title: SSR: Failed to resolve directive: click-away
issue.body:
I'm seeing this error when running node ssr locally:
`SSR: Failed to resolve directive: click-away`

The directive works however. 

I wonder if it is related to [this](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/9167)?
